title: What do the lyrics to 'Take Me To Church' mean, line by line? - Quora

response.answer_text: “My lover's got humor His girl is kind of an asshole and has a dark twisted sense of humor She's the giggle at a funeral She’s inappropriate Knows everybody's disapproval And gives no fucks what people think of her I should've worshipped her sooner It took him awhile to get used to her and realize how great she is If the Heavens ever did speak So great, that if the angels and God were to comment on her, they’d say She is the last true mouthpiece” She keeps it real and has no filter. She’s probably considered trashy by his stuck up religious family or peers. Every Sunday's getting more bleak As time progresses and he learns more about his religion and the agenda they push he sees it differently and realizes A fresh poison each week It’s not good, but poisonous and hateful 'We were born sick, ' you heard them say it TheY teach we are destined to fail and have some mysterious entity supposedly controlling everything. There’s no way to change your destiny My church offers no absolutes hes realized this through her rebellious spirit and brutal honesty, so he’s become his obsession and his truth. She is the answer to why he is here She tells me 'worship in the bedroom' She doesn’t believe in worshipping something you can’t see or interact with but he can shower love and attention in her bedroom The only heaven I'll be sent to She thinks heaven is bs Is when I'm alone with you And our time we live now, is our one chance to find our own heaven. For her, heaven is being with him . I was born sick, but I love it She embraces her deviant dirty instincts Command me to be well She wants to be dominated Amen. Amen. Amen here he’s agreeing very much Take me to church Take me to bed I'll worship like a dog at the shrine of your lies I’ll do whatever you want and don’t care if it’s true. I’m yours completely I'll tell you my sins and you can sharpen your knife I will open up and be vulnerable. I’ll tell you things about me that you can use against me later Offer me that deathless death So when you break me down and I hate you or just don’t care enough about you and die inside, although my body lives on Good God, let me give you my life I’ll do anything for you. You may have my soul if it were a thing I could give If I'm a pagan of the good times I’ll hang on to our happiness as long as I can My lover's the sunlight She is the only thing that can light his world or send him into darkness To keep the Goddess on my side he’ll work to get her whatever she wants She demands a sacrifice He will sacrifice his time, body, health etc to earn enough To drain the whole sea To get her material possessions that she wants Get something shiny Big ring, jewels, nice car, big house, spoil her Something meaty for the main course Some people might have to suffer for her to get all these things That's a fine looking high horse And he can see where people may try to speak poorly of his means to an end What you got in the stable? But everyone has skeletons We've a lot of starving faithful When you buy things from 3rd world countries with low pay and no worker rights, you are just as guilty of greed and selfishness That looks tasty Cuz you want it That looks plenty Lots of everything. More more more This is hungry work When you start being greedy, you’re never satisfied. You’re always hungry…. So he is telling the story of where this is going and where it ultimately ends up. At the end of the day, we are all greedy bastards

“My lover's got humour She's the giggle at a funeral Knows everybody's disapproval I should've worshipped her sooner If the Heavens ever did speak She is the last true mouthpiece” The author is beginning to describe his lover and set her up as a pagan god who is authentically divine and worthy of praise. Every Sunday's getting more bleak A fresh poison each week 'We were born sick, ' you heard them say it The author is criticizing Christianity, characterizing the message of original sin as fresh poison distributed each Sunday. My church offers no absolutes His new religion, the worship of his lover, is flexible and not restrictive like Christianity. She tells me 'worship in the bedroom' The only heaven I'll be sent to Is when I'm alone with you She prescribes worship and it is sex. He describes this worship as the true heaven. I was born sick, but I love it Command me to be well Amen. Amen. Amen Take me to church I'll worship like a dog at the shrine of your lies I'll tell you my sins and you can sharpen your knife Offer me that deathless death Good God, let me give you my life The chorus is a scathing critique of Christianity, where the parishioner is said to assume the role of a lowly dog worshiping a false religion. Confessing sin is seen as an opportunity for the clergy to take advantage of the parishioner. The last two lines are sarcastic. If I'm a pagan of the good times My lover's the sunlight To keep the Goddess on my side She demands a sacrifice To drain the whole sea Get something shiny Something meaty for the main course That's a fine looking high horse What you got in the stable? We've a lot of starving faithful That looks tasty That looks plenty This is hungry work This part is a bit more difficult. I think the author is describing his lover as demanding lots of sex in order to be satisfied with his “worship.” He juxtaposes this sexually fulfilling relationship with sex starved faithful Christians, who might look at his relationship with some envy. Anyway, that's my best go at it. Let me know what you think. Also just to clarify, I'm a Christian myself so I'm not personally on board with the message of the song.

Genius.com has an entry for Take Me to Church, with some info and quotes from Hozier himself. Overall, Hozier said this about the song: “It’s about sex and it’s about humanity, and obviously sex and humanity are incredibly tied. Sexuality, and sexual orientation — regardless of orientation — is just natural… The song is about asserting yourself and reclaiming your humanity through an act of love.” The line-by-line notes are available if you follow the link above. If there’s a specific line you wanted to know about I can copy it here, but it wouldn’t help you much to copy the entire song since it’s easier to reference on Genius.

You really need to understand pagan religion and the process of sacrifice aswell as popular pre Christian attitudes towards sex and death. There is no point interpreting this songs without that knowledge. The lover mentioned is a goddess. Possibly Ishtar, and she literally demands an animal sacrifice. The Christian concept of ‘Sin’ is ciriticized in the song. And the Christian concept of the divide between the secular and the sacred is heavily scrutinized.
Hozier – Take Me to Church Here you go
